description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 EDA, Local Development Agency (Lokala Utvecklingsbyrå) i Bosnien och Hercegovina, har lämnat in projektansökan till Sveriges ambassad för finansiering med 17,5 MSEK för att genomföra projektet för "Small Business Act" (SBA) i Bosnien och Hercegovina under perioden 2017-2020.
Interventionen syftar till att harmonisera strategiska och politiska ramar för små och medelstora företag i Bosnien och Hercegovina. Detta kommer att ske genom stöd till institutioner för att accelerera den ekonomiska integrationen med EU när det gäller strategiska och politiska ramar för små och medelstora företag. Förväntade resultat är harmoniserad juridisk, strategisk och politiskt ramverk för små och medelstora företag i Bosnien och Hercegovina baserat på SBA.
Projekts totala budget är 17,5 MSEK, varav 17 MSEK är för organisation, resterande belopp är för senare utvärdering.

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 EDA, Local Development Agency from BiH, has applied to Embassy of Sweden in BiH for funding of 17,5 million SEK to carry out the "Small Business Act Strategic Framework" in Bosnia and Herzegovina during the period 2017-2020.
The intervention aims at harmonizing of SME strategic and Policy Framework in BiH, to be in line with SBA. This will be done through supporting institutions to accelerate economic integration with the EU in the field of SME strategic and policy framework. Expected result is harmonized legal, strategic and policy framework for SMEs in BiH based on SBA.
The intervention’s total budget is 17,5 million SEK, out of which 16,7 MSEK is for organization and the remaining amount is for evaluation.

The overall goal of the Small Business Act project is to support institutions in Bosnia and Hercegovina to accelerate economic integration with the EU in the area of SMEs. The project also aims to harmonize the national legal, strategic and policy framework for SME development internally - between different administrative levels in the country and to interlink internal harmonization with the external EU SME framework. In order to use and adapt Small Business Act as a common methodological framework to harmonize legal, strategic and policy framework for SMEs in Bosnia and Hercegovina, the project encompasses all stages of policy development (planning, implementation, M&E, revision) and facilitating interactions of key stakeholders.

tag.narrative: 17.13 - Enhance global macroeconomic stability, including through policy coordination and policy coherence.
17.13 - Öka den makroekonomiska stabiliteten i världen, bland annat genom politisk samordning och samstämmig politik.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

9.b - Stödja inhemsk teknikutveckling, forskning och innovation i utvecklingsländerna, inklusive genom att säkerställa en gynnsam policymiljö för exempelvis industriell diversifiering och förädling av råvaror.

9.b - Support domestic technology development, research and innovation in developing countries, including by ensuring a conducive policy environment for, inter alia, industrial diversification and value addition to commodities.

description.narrative:
The work on development of SME related laws aligned with the SBA and their mutual harmonization taking into account different levels of governance continued. Process of final adoption of the Proposal Law on Stimulating Development of SMEs will most likely not be completed in 2021 for all levels of governance. In FBIH, although the adoption procedure is very slow due to other non-project related issues, the process is irreversible and the proposed solutions are very likely to be adopted at the later stage. Similarly, respective legislative alignment in Brcko District is delayed due to local elections and COVID 19 pandemic, however the final adoption is anticipated.
In regard to SBA - based parts of existing SME strategies and plans improved by SIEM - Strategy Implementation Enabling Mechanism all funded projects will be completed, including the experimental ones. Work related to standardized common methodology to formulate, implement and monitor/review SME strategies, are prepared and agreed between all stakeholders during 2020 and reporting period in 2021.
When it comes to the work related to harmonization of SME policies it is still ongoing and represents continuous process. Continuity is facilitating the process of integrating findings and recommendations from the project into relevant strategic documents and IPA III programming.
New SME strategy and and plan for the period after 2020 developed in accordance with the common methodology is developed and adopted by the RS in April 2021 and Brcko District in May 2021. However, delay in the adoption of FBIH Development strategy led to delays in drafting of the FBIH SME Development Strategy.
Some progress is being made in the are of establishing the fully functional, harmonized institution set-up for SME development. In regard to the state level, the establishment of new body for Public Private Dialogue (PPD) is not feasible due to political circumstances. The establishment of this body is no required provided that there are existing bodies that can contribute to the development of SMEs taking into consideration competencies of the state level. Due to delays in adoption of FBIH Law on Stimulating Development of SMEs in FBIH, the project was unable to facilitate its work during the reporting period.
In December 2020, the project organized 3rd annual (online) conference on supporting the development of SMEs and entrepreneurship in BIH contributed to implementation of result area related to promotion and harmonized SME policies and practices to local and international stakeholders that are supporting the SME development.
In September 2021 the project organized workshops and provided technical assistance to the partners on demand for each governance level (BiH, FBIH, RS) to support their respective efforts to provide required inputs to the OECD. The project cooperate with GiZ funded project "Innovation and digitalization of SMEs" to further support efforts on data collection for reporting purposes. SBA in BIH single portal is in development phase which will serve as an additional tool for monitoring implementation of SME strategies and plans. Moreover, it will be a valuable resource for SME Policy Index and BiH SBA Profile in the future. These activities contributed to the implementation of result area related to provision of assistance to partners in providing evidence - based assessment and reporting for OECD SME /SBA WBT preparation of SME Policy Index and BiH SBA Policy Profile.
In relations to cross-cutting aspects i.e. gender and environment, the project in May 2021, finalized and distributed a study relevant for gender related indicators in entrepreneurship along with recommendation for improving data collection and analysis in the area of SME development from gender perspective. The project during the reporting period also delivered trainings for women entrepreneurs in line with strategic documents relevant for Women Entrepreneurship.
Set of sub-projects "piloting and promoting Energy Efficiency Networks in Industry" started during the reporting period.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
